p: Hepatitis B infection or liver fibrosis; chronic hepatitis B was diagnosed if HBV history or HBV markers were persistently positive for more than six months and serum alanine aminotransferase levels exceeded 80 IU/L, and hepatic fibrosis was estimated by indexes containing the following markers: HA, LN, C-IV, PIIIP ( 13). Results indicators including Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT), Aspartate Aminotransferase (AST), TBIL, gamma-Glutamyl Transpeptidase (Î³-GGT), Alkaline Phosphatase (ALP), Hyaluronic acid (HA), Laminin (LN), Collagen type IV (CIV), and Procollagen III peptide (PIIIP). Trials were limited to those comparing the efficacy of different drugs or placebo.
